answers.answer: Has your doctor scheduled an appointment with a dietician,  or nurse to go over your diet?I had GD with my first pregnancy and was fine,  but you do have to alter your diet and if you want sweets you need to eat them in small quantities.Get a specific diet guideline from your doc.  Lots of "whole" foods - and fewer processed foods is basically the idea.  Chicken,  beef,  turkey, whole raw or steamed vegetables,  very few sodas or fruit juices or white bread/cake,  candies and cookies.

I have gestational diabetes this pregnancy as well. Just wait till you see your dietician to change your diet.. Each persons diet is made for them specifically.  I am not aloud any sweets and fruit twice a day only... I poke my finger 4 times a day.. its not to hard to get used to, but having cravings you cant fulfill *****. Good luck it will be ok!
Thanks guys so much. I'm waiting on the nurse to call me to make an appointment with a dietitian.
